column4: hi people, can anyone help me? i have no sound on flash videos in any browser i try... i'm using kubuntu 9.10 on a 32 bit platform.
does sound work otherwise?
yes, it is working on amarok and kaffeine, although not on VLC
i tried everything at VLC...default configuration, alsa, OSS (which worked before), pulseaudio, etc...
perhaps pulseaudio is not setup right?
i've removed pulseaudio in order to set up things right, but nothing happened
hrm, have you checked vlc and such to make sure that it's pointing to the alsa driver?
yes, I have tried on vlc but there's no sound on whatever i choose... before, it worked when I chose OSS, but not with alsa or anything else
did you vlc to use alsa specifically, or just default?
okay, and when you choose a different audio output, are you restarting vlc?
try switching to alsa, restart vlc, and play from there
it didn't work at all
that's weird...
you're sure your user is authorized to use all audio devices?
that's not what I meant. if you go to system->admin->users & groups, you can see what access permissions you have there.
hey, i've just fixed VLC...on audio, I chose OSS and the output via soundcard, Ensoniq whatever...
awesome
although, where did you install your flash support from?
i installed the flash, at first, from the adobe site...then, as it didn't work, from synaptic, flashplugin-installer and nonfree-extrasound...
did you remove the installed version from the adobe site first?
thank you for trying to hlp me, but i have to go... maybe some other time... thanks a lot anyway...bye bye guys
good luck
